result: Hans Kelson's theory is that elections are an essential element of real democracy, not ideal democracy which exists nowhere. Exemplary quote from a Supreme Court judge of the United States on the occasion of an election in 1902: "The electoral cabin is the temple of American institutions, where each of us is a priest, to which he is entrusted the guard of the ark of the covenant and each officer of his own altar." The metaphors used in the text refer to a conception of democracy based on A) Theistic justification of law. B) Rigidity of the class hierarchy. C) Formalism emphasis on administration. D) Protagonism of the executive in power. E) Centrality of the individual in society.
